paragraph.paragraph: From time to time, as a result to modifications to a project, a compiling_project.xmlcompilation will fail as a direct effect of modification to the project as the project evolves. The Eiffel compiler will report any such failure with a detailed error message in the vxurfOutputWindow 0 Output Window when the error occurs. The Visual Studio .NET vxurfTaskListS 0 Task List will also be populated with the error message and automatically switched to upon a compilation error.

Upon receiving a error during compilation it is possible to locate the source of the project using the vxurfTaskListS 0 Task List . To locate the source, find the error in the list and double left mouse click on it. If the error is associated with a file in the project, the file will be opened in the url *Eiffel Editor and the line number, if available, highlighted in the editor. Correcting the error may not remove the error from the vxurfTaskListS 0 Task List immediately, because its status requires a subsequent compilation.

Not all errors are compilation errors, but are errors of the vxconProjectBuilds 0 build process. Many more steps than those mentioned in the simple url *Eiffel for .NET take place during a build. Some errors have no files associated with them; these types or errors are the result of misconfiguring your project's url *properties or are due to events external to Visual Studio .NET. In any respect, these errors are reported and you must facilitate their correction before compilation can continue.

During compilation, warnings may appear. Warnings in a EiffelEnvision vxconProjectBuilds 0 build are not fatal and require the build process to be stopped. In all other respects, warnings are handled the same as errors are. Each warning has its own entry in the vxurfTaskListS 0 Task List and may be navigated to in the same way. The Eiffel compiling_project.xmlcompilation warnings may be suppressed by setting the url*Show Compiler Warnings in the configuration specific url*Build Project Properties to No.
